msContents.summary: Receipt for payment of a sum to the praepositus of the patrimonium for the value of barley owned by the village of Pela; at the beginning there are calculations about the sum to be paid which appears to be connected to a reinbursement from the government for a requisition

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; some text is missing on the left and on the top; on the back there is an unpublished letter
14 lines of writing in rapid cursives
Perhaps the item reimbursed is clothing or raw material
The consuls Ovinius Gallicanus and Caesonius Bassus were not previously attested in Egypt before July

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in 1924; no. 19 (box XIVc) in Bell's inventory

div.ab: . . . 2250 drachmas less 6 1/2 percent (140 drachmas) less adaeratio for the 23rd year (101 drachmas) equals a remainder of 2009 drachmas;...6...337 drachmas less 6 1/2 percent (22 drachmas) equals a remainder of 315 drachmas; total 5 talents, 3142 drachmas which he pays to Claudius, praepositus of the patrimonium, for the price of barley for Pela for the fourth indiction, in full. The receipt is normative and in answer to the formal question I gave my assent. In the consulship of Ovinius Gallicanus and Caesonius Bassus the most illustrious, Pharmouthi 29. I, Aurelius Horion son of Herminus, paid the money as aforesaid.
